name: Kirbinator
description:
This algorithm continuously records audio into a buffer and plays slices of the buffer under the influence of various probabilities. The slices can be pitched up and down, played forwards and backwards, and panned in stereo.

Key to its operation are two trigger inputs: the Mark input (defining slice boundaries) and the Trigger input (instructing playback changes). By default, behavior is random but can be made repeatable via a Random seed parameter. The algorithm supports transient detection for automatic marking, unclocked operations with adjustable play probabilities, and feedback for delay/echo effects.

The audio buffer is stereo but can operate in mono/stereo modes based on routing parameters.
use_cases: Rhythmic slice playback with probabilistic pitch/direction changes
Automated granular synthesis via transient detection
Repeatable stochastic patterns using random seeds
gui_description: Displays a waveform of the audio buffer. A short dark line shows current recording position, longer lines indicate playback positions, and checkmarks mark slice boundaries defined by the Mark input.

input_ports.name: Audio input (left/mono)
input_ports.description: Left or mono audio signal input, selectable via routing parameters.

input_ports.name: Audio input (right)
input_ports.description: Right audio signal input. Disabled if operating in mono mode.

input_ports.name: Mark
input_ports.description: Trigger input defining slice boundaries in the buffer. Typically a clock but can be any signal.

input_ports.name: Trigger
input_ports.description: Trigger input initiating playback changes and selecting new slices.

input_ports.name: Stop
input_ports.description: Trigger input to halt current slice playback.

input_ports.name: Pitch offset CV
input_ports.description: 1V/octave control voltage input for dynamic pitch offset adjustments.

output_ports.name: Audio output (left/mono)
output_ports.description: Left or mono processed audio output, selectable via routing parameters.

output_ports.name: Audio output (right)
output_ports.description: Right processed audio output. Disabled if operating in mono mode.
